oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Logistic analysis of responses to the 2018 survey of AABP members about gender bias
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gilliam, G. N.
White, B. J.
Fajt, V. R.
Wagner, S. A.
Apley, M. D.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: gender bias
client
employer
veterinary practice
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In 2018, a survey regarding member perceptions related to gender bias encountered in clinical practice settings was made available to the members of the American Association of Bovine Practitioners. The definition of gender bias included with the survey was “when a member of 1 gender is advantaged or disadvantaged for the reason of their gender”.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2020; 367
